avalancheActivity.comment: The avalanche risk is rated as moderate above 1,800 metres and low below that. Fresh snowdrift accumulations can be triggered as slab avalanches in some places even with little additional load and can also reach medium size when breaking through into the persistent weak layer. The danger areas are still located in the north to east aspects behind ridgelines and terrain edges as well as in the entrance areas to steep gullies and bowls.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Persistent weak layer problem and some wind slab!

snowpackStructure.comment: In the southern Niedere Tauern and in the Eisenerz Alps, a few centimetres of new fallen snow or wind slab have been added. This covers surface hoar and older wind slab in the higher elevations. In the northern and eastern exposures, the snowpack is still weakened with faceted crystals and floating snow (persistent weak layer problem!).

tendency.highlights: Very sunny again on Tuesday with an increasingly southerly flow. No significant change in the avalanche risk is expected.

weatherForecast.comment:
The rain and snowfall will subside before midnight and it will become partly soft in the second half of the night. There will still be some clouds in the morning on Monday.  During the day, increasingly sunny mountain weather will prevail.
The temperature at an altitude of 2000 metres will be between -6 and -3 degrees. The temperature at an altitude of 1500 metres will be between -4 and -1 degrees. Brisk winds with gusts of around 50 km/h from south to north-west. The snowfall level is in the valleys.

avalancheActivity.comment: The avalanche danger is assessed as low. The main issue is the persistent weak layer problem. The few avalanche prone locations are in the northern sector. Snow slabs can be triggered here if there is a large additional load.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Persistent weak layer problem in the northern sector!

snowpackStructure.comment: The old snowpack is weakened by the kinetic metamorphism (angular shapes). There is little snow on the sunny slopes.

tendency.highlights:
Strong southerly foehn along the main ridge on Wednesday, with a front moving over from the south in the evening.
No change in the avalanche danger is expected.

weatherForecast.comment:
A few snowflakes will fall along the northern Alps during the night and the westerly wind will freshen up temporarily. Otherwise, the sky will be clear with moderate westerly winds. Tuesday will then bring mostly sunny mountain weather, and the shallow patches of fog over most of the valleys will clear by mid-morning. During the afternoon, extensive cloud fields will appear in the west.
The temperature at an altitude of 2000 metres will be between -5 and -0 degrees. The temperature at an altitude of 1500 metres will be between -4 and 3 degrees. Moderate winds with gusts of around 40 km/h from the west.

avalancheActivity.comment: The avalanche risk is low. In extremely steep gullies and on shady slopes above the tree line, the triggering of small slab avalanches cannot be completely ruled out. Fresh pillows of wind drifted snow can be triggered as small avalanches behind ridges.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Low avalanche danger, isolated avalanche prone locations on shady slopes!

snowpackStructure.comment: In the last 24 hours, fresh wind slab snow (approx. 10 to 15 cm) has been deposited on a crusted can form old snowpack. Angular shapes weaken the snow layering.

tendency.highlights: Very sunny again on Tuesday with an increasingly southerly flow. No significant change in the avalanche danger is expected.

weatherForecast.comment: Tuesday will bring mostly sunny mountain weather, and the shallow patches of fog over most valleys will clear in the morning. During the afternoon, extensive cloud fields will appear in the west. The wind will be particularly noticeable from the Gleinalpe to the Schöckl. The temperature at an altitude of 1500 metres will be between -5 and -0 degrees. The temperature at an altitude of 1000 metres will be between -2 and 3 degrees. Moderate winds with gusts around 30 km/h from southwest to northwest.

ALBINA.generalHeadline: New fallen snow - focus on the Gurk and Seetal Alps!
